importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The game took place on October 17, 2025, marking a significant matchup between two veteran quarterbacks in an NFL regular-season game, highlighting the enduring competitiveness of older athletes.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The game was played during Thursday Night Football, a prime time slot, reinforcing its visibility and cultural significance in American sports viewing habits.

keyTakeAways: Joe Flacco, 40 years old, outperformed Aaron Rodgers, 41 years old, in a high-scoring game that exemplified the continued viability of veteran quarterbacks in the NFL.
The Bengals defeated the Steelers 33-31 in a game dubbed the 'Icy Hot Bowl,' showcasing resilience and strong team execution under pressure.
Flacco threw for 342 yards and three touchdowns, including one each to Ja’Marr Chase, Tee Higgins, and Noah Fant, and led a crucial two-minute drive that culminated in a winning field goal.
The game featured a dramatic comeback attempt by Rodgers, who scored a 68-yard touchdown to tie the game with less than two minutes remaining, but failed to recover in the final seconds.
Rodgers moved into fifth place on the NFL all-time career passing yards list, passing Ben Roethlisberger, a milestone in his long career.
The Bengals improved to 3-4 on the season, while the Steelers fell to 4-2 but remain atop the AFC North.

Both Chase and Higgins had breakout performances, with Chase recording 16 catches for 161 yards and Higgins six catches for 96 yards (a season high), and Chase Brown rushing for over 100 yards for the first time this season.
The game emphasized the role of veteran leadership and experience, especially in high-stakes matchups, and demonstrated that the NFL is not solely a 'young man’s game'.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a high-stakes Thursday Night Football matchup dubbed the 'Icy Hot Bowl,' 40-year-old Joe Flacco outperformed 41-year-old Aaron Rodgers in a dramatic 33-31 victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers, showcasing the enduring skill of veteran quarterbacks. Despite the Steelers taking an early 10-0 lead, the Bengals mounted a powerful 20-point comeback, with Flacco throwing for 342 yards and three touchdowns, including a crucial two-minute drive that ended in a winning field goal. Rodgers, though outmatched in the final moments, achieved a historic milestone by surpassing Ben Roethlisberger on the NFL's all-time passing yards list. The game highlighted the resilience of both teams and the significance of veteran leadership in the NFL, with key performances from Bengals receivers Ja’Marr Chase and Tee Higgins and running back Chase Brown. The Bengals improved to 3-4 on the season, while the Steelers fell to 4-2 and remain atop the AFC North, setting up a future showdown with the Green Bay Packers.
title: Joe Flacco outduels Aaron Rodgers in battle of elder statesmen as Bengals stun Steelers in ‘Icy Hot Bowl’
